ai.summary: A short coastal walk from Hannigarth to Sandwick Beach in the UK. This easy 1.4 km route follows a coastal path with sea views and a mostly flat surface, suitable for most ages and casual walkers.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly flat to gently undulating coastal trail with sections of compact gravel, boardwalks, and a brief stretch along a pebbly beach. Some parts may be slippery when wet and can be windy near the shore.
ai.safety_notes: Check local tide times before starting, as a portion of the route can be exposed and may be inaccessible at high tide. Weather can change quickly along the coast; bring waterproof clothing and dress in layers. The path can be uneven and windy; wear sturdy footwear and stay away from cliff edges and unstable ground. Keep an eye on children and dogs, and carry a phone with a charged battery and a means to communicate in an emergency.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking footwear with good grip
Lightweight waterproof jacket and extra layer
Map, compass or offline maps on your phone
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn for milder weather and reliable coastal conditions. Year-round hiking is possible but winters can bring strong winds, rain, and mud.
